schema.description: Identifier
Identifier

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

GET /zones/{zone_identifier}/dns_records.description: List, search, sort, and filter a zones' DNS records.

schema.description: Identifier
DNS record name (or @ for the zone apex) in Punycode.
Record type.
DNS record content.
Whether the record is receiving the performance and security benefits of Cloudflare.

Whether to match all search requirements or at least one (any). If set to `all`, acts like a logical AND between filters. If set to `any`, acts like a logical OR instead. Note that the interaction between tag filters is controlled by the `tag-match` parameter instead.
Exact value of the DNS record comment. This is a convenience alias for `comment.exact`.

parameters.description: If this parameter is present, only records *with* a comment are returned.
parameters.name: comment.present

parameters.description: If this parameter is present, only records *without* a comment are returned.
parameters.name: comment.absent

schema.description: Exact value of the DNS record comment. Comment filters are case-insensitive.
Substring of the DNS record comment. Comment filters are case-insensitive.
Prefix of the DNS record comment. Comment filters are case-insensitive.
Suffix of the DNS record comment. Comment filters are case-insensitive.

Condition on the DNS record tag.

Parameter values can be of the form `<tag-name>:<tag-value>` to search for an exact `name:value` pair, or just `<tag-name>` to search for records with a specific tag name regardless of its value.

This is a convenience shorthand for the more powerful `tag.<predicate>` parameters.
Examples:
- `tag=important` is equivalent to `tag.present=important`
- `tag=team:DNS` is equivalent to `tag.exact=team:DNS`
Name of a tag which must be present on the DNS record. Tag filters are case-insensitive.
Name of a tag which must *not* be present on the DNS record. Tag filters are case-insensitive.
A tag and value, of the form `<tag-name>:<tag-value>`. The API will only return DNS records that have a tag named `<tag-name>` whose value is `<tag-value>`. Tag filters are case-insensitive.
A tag and value, of the form `<tag-name>:<tag-value>`. The API will only return DNS records that have a tag named `<tag-name>` whose value contains `<tag-value>`. Tag filters are case-insensitive.
A tag and value, of the form `<tag-name>:<tag-value>`. The API will only return DNS records that have a tag named `<tag-name>` whose value starts with `<tag-value>`. Tag filters are case-insensitive.
A tag and value, of the form `<tag-name>:<tag-value>`. The API will only return DNS records that have a tag named `<tag-name>` whose value ends with `<tag-value>`. Tag filters are case-insensitive.

Allows searching in multiple properties of a DNS record simultaneously. This parameter is intended for human users, not automation. Its exact behavior is intentionally left unspecified and is subject to change in the future. This parameter works independently of the `match` setting. For automated searches, please use the other available parameters.

Whether to match all tag search requirements or at least one (any). If set to `all`, acts like a logical AND between tag filters. If set to `any`, acts like a logical OR instead. Note that the regular `match` parameter is still used to combine the resulting condition with other filters that aren't related to tags.
Page number of paginated results.
Number of DNS records per page.
Field to order DNS records by.
Direction to order DNS records in.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

count.description: Total number of results for the requested service

page.description: Current page within paginated list of results

per_page.description: Number of results per page of results

total_count.description: Total results available without any search parameters

content.description: A valid IPv4 address.

name.description: DNS record name (or @ for the zone apex) in Punycode.

proxied.description: Whether the record is receiving the performance and security benefits of Cloudflare.

comment.description: Comments or notes about the DNS record. This field has no effect on DNS responses.

locked.description: Whether this record can be modified/deleted (true means it's managed by Cloudflare).

meta.description: Extra Cloudflare-specific information about the record.

auto_added.description: Will exist if Cloudflare automatically added this DNS record during initial setup.

modified_on.description: When the record was last modified.

proxiable.description: Whether the record can be proxied by Cloudflare or not.

tags.description: Custom tags for the DNS record. This field has no effect on DNS responses.

items.description: Individual tag of the form name:value (the name must consist of only letters, numbers, underscores and hyphens)

ttl.description: Time To Live (TTL) of the DNS record in seconds. Setting to 1 means 'automatic'. Value must be between 60 and 86400, with the minimum reduced to 30 for Enterprise zones.

content.description: A valid IPv6 address.

POST /zones/{zone_identifier}/dns_record.description:
Create a new DNS record for a zone.

Notes:
- A/AAAA records cannot exist on the same name as CNAME records.
- NS records cannot exist on the same name as any other record type.
- Domain names are always represented in Punycode, even if Unicode
  characters were used when creating the record.

POST /zones/{zone_identifier}/dns_record.description:
You can upload your [BIND config](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zone_file "Zone file") through this endpoint. It assumes that cURL is called from a location with bind_config.txt (valid BIND config) present.

See [the documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/dns/manage-dns-records/how-to/import-and-export/ "Import and export records") for more information.

schema.description: Identifier

file.description:
BIND config to import.

**Tip:** When using cURL, a file can be uploaded using `--form 'file=@bind_config.txt'`.

proxied.description:
Whether or not proxiable records should receive the performance and security benefits of Cloudflare.

The value should be either `true` or `false`.

process_time.description: Processing time of the file in seconds.

PUT /zones/{zone_identifier}/dns_records.description:
Update an existing DNS record.

Notes:
- A/AAAA records cannot exist on the same name as CNAME records.
- NS records cannot exist on the same name as any other record type.
- Domain names are always represented in Punycode, even if Unicode
  characters were used when creating the record.

schema.description: Identifier
Identifier

proxiable.description: Whether the record can be proxied by Cloudflare or not.

tags.description: Custom tags for the DNS record. This field has no effect on DNS responses.

items.description: Individual tag of the form name:value (the name must consist of only letters, numbers, underscores and hyphens)

ttl.description: Time To Live (TTL) of the DNS record in seconds. Setting to 1 means 'automatic'. Value must be between 60 and 86400, with the minimum reduced to 30 for Enterprise zones.

content.description: Formatted TLSA content. See 'data' to set TLSA properties.

name.description: DNS record name (or @ for the zone apex) in Punycode.

comment.description: Comments or notes about the DNS record. This field has no effect on DNS responses.

meta.description: Extra Cloudflare-specific information about the record.
